title: HumanGif: Single-View Human Diffusion with Generative Prior
author: Shoukang Hu (Sony AI, Japan), Takuya Narihira (Sony AI, Japan), Kazumi Fukuda (Sony AI, Japan), Ryosuke Sawata (Sony AI, Japan), Takashi Shibuya (Sony AI, Japan), Yuki Mitsufuji (Sony Group Corporation, Japan), ...
relevance_why: The techniques used in this paper, particularly the generative prior and diffusion models, could inspire new approaches in audio generation tasks where audio-visual alignment is needed.
background: Generating realistic 3D human avatars from a single image while maintaining consistency in both view and pose, which is useful for applications in augmented and virtual reality.
contribution: This paper introduces HumanGif to solve the challenge of single-view human diffusion synthesis, achieving improved perceptual quality in novel view and pose outputs.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods struggled to produce view-consistent and pose-consistent outputs due to limited input information, often leading to blurring or loss of details.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances results by incorporating a Human Neural Radiance Field module and a novel image-level loss to maintain consistency across latent and image spaces.

key_innovation: Combines generative diffusion models with detailed rendering techniques to synthesize human images that are realistic and maintain fine-grained details visible in reference poses.
real_world_impact: The methodology proposed has significant implications for industries like gaming and film, allowing for more realistic human animations from single images.
limitations: The authors mention that there are still artifacts in produced results and struggles with aligning target images with input.

new_terms.Neural Radiance Field: **Neural Radiance Field (NeRF)** refers to a volumetric rendering technique that learns to synthesize novel views of complex 3D scenes using neural networks.

open_sourcing: Code will be released at https://github.com/skhu101/HumanGif.
